content.description: This steep arete climb has continuous 5.12 climbing that leads to a compression boulder problem crux, followed by easier climbing protected on gear. Start with either a shitty first piece or just stick clip the first bolt. Try to rest at the fourth bolt then fire through the desperation. Place a hand size in the horizontal and finish up the crack/face to the bolted anchor.
content.location: Climb is located on the north arete. Left edge of the steep streaked wall.

content.description: Upside Down Rock, as dubbed and climbed by the Conns in 1951, is steep on all sides save for the SW face. Most easily recognized by it's streaked NW aspect that faces towards the overflow parking lot.
